nodes.name: Address

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the
name.
nodes.name: symbol

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the smallest part of the token that is not divisible. This
means all token operations (creation, movement and destruction) must have
amounts that are a multiple of this number.
     * For most token contracts, this value will equal 1.
nodes.name: granularity

nodes.documentation:
@dev See `IERC20.transfer`.
    * Unlike `send`, `recipient` is _not_ required to implement the `tokensReceived`
interface if it is a contract.
    * Also emits a `Sent` event.

     * Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators may

nodes.documentation:
@dev See `IERC20.transferFrom`.
    * Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators cannot
call `transferFrom` (unless they have allowance), and accounts with
allowance cannot call `operatorSend` (unless they are operators).
    * Emits `Sent` and `Transfer` events.

nodes.documentation:
@dev Creates `amount` tokens and assigns them to `account`, increasing
the total supply.
     * If a send hook is registered for `raccount`, the corresponding function
will be called with `operator`, `data` and `operatorData`.
     * See `IERC777Sender` and `IERC777Recipient`.
     * Emits `Sent` and `Transfer` events.
     * Requirements
     * - `account` cannot be the zero address.
- if `account` is a contract, it must implement the `tokensReceived`
interface.
nodes.name: mintToken

nodes.documentation:
@dev Creates `amount` tokens and assigns them to `account`, increasing
the total supply.
     * If a send hook is registered for `raccount`, the corresponding function
will be called with `operator`, `data` and `operatorData`.
     * See `IERC777Sender` and `IERC777Recipient`.
     * Emits `Sent` and `Transfer` events.
     * Requirements
     * - `account` cannot be the zero address.
- if `account` is a contract, it must implement the `tokensReceived`
interface.
nodes.name: mintToken

nodes.documentation: Total mintableToken pending in the system
nodes.name: mintableToken

allowance(address,address).details: See `IERC20.allowance`.     * Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators may not have allowance, and accounts with allowance may not be operators themselves.

approve(address,uint256).details: See `IERC20.approve`.     * Note that accounts cannot have allowance issued by their operators.

params._operator: The operator that wants to be Authorized

granularity().details: Returns the smallest part of the token that is not divisible. This means all token operations (creation, movement and destruction) must have amounts that are a multiple of this number.     * For most token contracts, this value will equal 1.

params._operator: address to check if it has the right to manage the tokens
params._tokenHolder: address which holds the tokens to be managed

mintToken(address,address,uint256,bytes,.details: Creates `amount` tokens and assigns them to `account`, increasing the total supply.     * If a send hook is registered for `raccount`, the corresponding function will be called with `operator`, `data` and `operatorData`.     * See `IERC777Sender` and `IERC777Recipient`.     * Emits `Sent` and `Transfer` events.     * Requirements     * - `account` cannot be the zero address. - if `account` is a contract, it must implement the `tokensReceived` interface.

params._amount: The number of tokens to be sent
params._data: Data generated by the user to be sent to the recipient
params._from: The address holding the tokens being sent
params._operatorData: Data generated by the operator to be sent to the recipient

params._operator: The operator that wants to be Revoked

params._amount: The number of tokens to be sent

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalSupply().details: Returns the amount of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See `IERC20.transfer`.    * Unlike `send`, `recipient` is _not_ required to implement the `tokensReceived` interface if it is a contract.    * Also emits a `Sent` event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See `IERC20.transferFrom`.    * Note that operator and allowance concepts are orthogonal: operators cannot call `transferFrom` (unless they have allowance), and accounts with allowance cannot call `operatorSend` (unless they are operators).    * Emits `Sent` and `Transfer` events.

params._newOwner: the address of new owner of the smartcontract

authorizeOperator(address).notice: Authorize a third party `_operator` to manage (send) `msg.sender`'s tokens.

isOperatorFor(address,address).notice: Check whether the `_operator` address is allowed to manage the tokens held by `_tokenHolder` address.

mintableToken().notice: Total mintableToken pending in the system

operatorSend(address,address,uint256,byt.notice: Send `_amount` of tokens on behalf of the address `from` to the address `to`.

revokeOperator(address).notice: Revoke a third party `_operator`'s rights to manage (send) `msg.sender`'s tokens.

send(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Send `_amount` of tokens to address `_to` passing `_data` to the recipient

transferOwnership(address).notice: Transfer ownership of contract to another account
